recommended_action: Modify the autoscaling instance to enable scaling across multiple availability zones.
title: ASG Multiple AZ
description: Ensures that ASGs are created to be cross-AZ for high availability.

recommended_action: Create an origin access identity for CloudFront, then make the contents of the S3 bucket private.
title: Public S3 CloudFront Origin
description: Detects the use of an S3 bucket as a CloudFront origin without an origin access identity

recommended_action: Ensure that traffic sent between CloudFront and its origin is passed over HTTPS and uses TLSv1.1 or higher. Do not use the match-viewer option.
title: Secure CloudFront Origin
description: Detects the use of secure web origins with secure protocols for CloudFront.

recommended_action: Ensure that traffic sent between viewers and CloudFront is passed over HTTPS and uses TLSv1, not SSLv3.
title: Insecure CloudFront Protocols
description: Detects the use of insecure HTTPS SSL/TLS protocols for use with HTTPS traffic between viewers and CloudFront

recommended_action: Remove HTTP-only listeners from distributions.
title: CloudFront HTTPS Only
description: Ensures CloudFront distributions are configured to redirect non-HTTPS traffic to HTTPS.

recommended_action: Enable CloudFront request logging.
title: CloudFront Logging Enabled
description: Ensures CloudFront distributions have request logging enabled.

recommended_action: Enable access logging on the CloudTrail bucket from the S3 console
title: CloudTrail Bucket Access Logging
description: Ensures CloudTrail logging bucket has access logging enabled to detect tampering of log files

recommended_action: Enable MFA delete on the CloudTrail bucket
title: CloudTrail Bucket Delete Policy
description: Ensures CloudTrail logging bucket has a policy to prevent deletion of logs without an MFA token

recommended_action: Enable CloudTrail for all regions and ensure that at least one region monitors global service events
title: CloudTrail Enabled
description: Ensures CloudTrail is enabled for all regions within an account

recommended_action: Enable CloudTrail log encryption through the CloudTrail console or API
title: CloudTrail Encryption
description: Ensures CloudTrail encryption at rest is enabled for logs

recommended_action: Enable CloudTrail file validation for all regions
title: CloudTrail File Validation
description: Ensures CloudTrail file validation is enabled for all regions within an account

recommended_action: Enable CloudTrail CloudWatch integration for all regions
title: CloudTrail To CloudWatch
description: Ensures CloudTrail logs are being properly delivered to CloudWatch

recommended_action: Set the S3 bucket access policy for all CloudTrail buckets to only allow known users to access its files.
title: CloudTrail Bucket Private
description: Ensures CloudTrail logging bucket is not publicly accessible

recommended_action: Enable the AWS Config Service for all regions and resources in an account. Ensure that it is properly recording and delivering logs.
title: Config Service Enabled
description: Ensures the AWS Config Service is enabled to detect changes to account resources

recommended_action: Update the rules for the default security group to deny all traffic by default
title: Default Security Group
description: Ensure the default security groups block all traffic by default

recommended_action: Contact AWS support to increase the number of EIPs available
title: Elastic IP Limit
description: Determine if the number of allocated EIPs is close to the AWS per-account limit

recommended_action: Add a new subnet with larger CIDR block and migrate resources.
title: Subnet IP Availability
description: Determine if a subnet is at risk of running out of IP addresses

recommended_action: Limit the number of security groups to prevent accidental authorizations
title: Excessive Security Groups
description: Determine if there are an excessive number of security groups in the account

recommended_action: Contact AWS support to increase the number of instances available
title: Instance Limit
description: Determine if the number of EC2 instances is close to the AWS per-account limit

recommended_action: Modify the security group to specify a specific port and protocol to allow.
title: Open All Ports Protocols
description: Determine if security group has all ports or protocols open to the public

recommended_action: Restrict UDP port 445 to known IP addresses
title: Open CIFS
description: Determine if UDP port 445 for CIFS is open to the public

recommended_action: Restrict TCP and UDP port 53 to known IP addresses
title: Open DNS
description: Determine if TCP or UDP port 53 for DNS is open to the public

recommended_action: Restrict TCP ports 20 and 21 to known IP addresses
title: Open FTP
description: Determine if TCP port 20 or 21 for FTP is open to the public

recommended_action: Restrict TCP ports 4333 and 3306 to known IP addresses
title: Open MySQL
description: Determine if TCP port 4333 or 3306 for MySQL is open to the public

recommended_action: Restrict UDP ports 137 and 138 to known IP addresses
title: Open NetBIOS
description: Determine if UDP port 137 or 138 for NetBIOS is open to the public

recommended_action: Restrict TCP port 5432 to known IP addresses
title: Open PostgreSQL
description: Determine if TCP port 5432 for PostgreSQL is open to the public

recommended_action: Restrict TCP port 3389 to known IP addresses
title: Open RDP
description: Determine if TCP port 3389 for RDP is open to the public

recommended_action: Restrict TCP port 135 to known IP addresses
title: Open RPC
description: Determine if TCP port 135 for RPC is open to the public

recommended_action: Restrict TCP port 445 to known IP addresses
title: Open SMBoTCP
description: Determine if TCP port 445 for Windows SMB over TCP is open to the public

recommended_action: Restrict TCP port 25 to known IP addresses
title: Open SMTP
description: Determine if TCP port 25 for SMTP is open to the public

recommended_action: Restrict TCP port 1433 and UDP port 1434 to known IP addresses
title: Open SQL Server
description: Determine if TCP port 1433 or UDP port 1434 for SQL Server is open to the public

recommended_action: Restrict TCP port 22 to known IP addresses
title: Open SSH
description: Determine if TCP port 22 for SSH is open to the public

recommended_action: Restrict TCP port 23 to known IP addresses
title: Open Telnet
description: Determine if TCP port 23 for Telnet is open to the public

recommended_action: Restrict TCP port 5500 to known IP addresses
title: Open VNC Client
description: Determine if TCP port 5500 for VNC Client is open to the public

recommended_action: Restrict TCP port 5900 to known IP addresses
title: Open VNC Server
description: Determine if TCP port 5900 for VNC Server is open to the public

recommended_action: Contact AWS support to increase the number of EIPs available
title: VPC Elastic IP Limit
description: Determine if the number of allocated VPC EIPs is close to the AWS per-account limit

recommended_action: Migrate instances from EC2 Classic to VPC
title: Detect EC2 Classic Instances
description: Ensures AWS VPC is being used for instances instead of EC2 Classic

recommended_action: Enable VPC flow logs for each VPC
title: VPC Flow Logs Enabled
description: Ensures VPC flow logs are enabled for traffic logging

recommended_action: Create multiple networks/subnets in each VPC and change the architecture to take advantage of public and private tiers.
title: VPC Multiple Subnets
description: Ensures that VPCs have multiple networks to provide a layered architecture

recommended_action: Structure security groups to provide a single category of access and do not duplicate rules across groups used by the same instances.
title: Overlapping Security Groups
description: Determine if EC2 instances have security groups that share the same rules

recommended_action: Convert the public AMI a private image.
title: Public AMI
description: Checks for publicly shared AMIs

recommended_action: Create an Amazon EC2 instance backed by encrypted EBS volume.
title: Encrypted AMI
description: Checks for encrypted root EBS volume for AMI

recommended_action: Attach an IAM role to the EC2 instance
title: Instance IAM Role
description: Ensures EC2 instances are using an IAM role instead of hard-coded AWS credentials

recommended_action: Enable encryption for EBS volumes.
title: EBS Encryption Enabled
description: Ensures EBS volumes are encrypted at rest

recommended_action: Launch managed NAT instances in multiple AZs.
title: NAT Multiple AZ
description: Ensures managed NAT instances exist in at least 2 AZs for availability purposes

recommended_action: Move resources from the default VPC to a new VPC created for that application or resource group.
title: Default VPC In Use
description: Determines whether the default VPC is being used for launching EC2 instances.

recommended_action: Update your ELBs to use the recommended cipher suites
title: Insecure Ciphers
description: Detect use of insecure ciphers on ELBs

recommended_action: Remove non-HTTPS listeners from load balancer.
title: ELB HTTPS Only
description: Ensures ELBs are configured to only accept connections on HTTPS ports.

recommended_action: Enable ELB request logging
title: ELB Logging Enabled
description: Ensures load balancers have request logging enabled.

recommended_action: Delete old ELBs that no longer have backend resources.
title: ELB No Instances
description: Detects ELBs that have no backend instances attached

recommended_action: Remove the extra access key for the specified user.
title: Access Keys Extra
description: Detects the use of more than one access key by any single user

recommended_action: Log into the IAM portal and remove the offending access key.
title: Access Keys Last Used
description: Detects access keys that have not been used for a period of time and that should be decommissioned

recommended_action: To rotate an access key, first create a new key, replace the key and secret throughout your app or scripts, then set the previous key to disabled. Once you ensure that no services are broken, then fully delete the old key.
title: Access Keys Rotated
description: Ensures access keys are not older than 180 days in order to reduce accidental exposures

recommended_action: Update your certificates before the expiration date
title: Certificate Expiry
description: Detect upcoming expiration of certificates used with ELBs

recommended_action: Remove unused groups without users
title: Empty Groups
description: Ensures all groups have at least one member

recommended_action: Keep two users with admin permissions but ensure other IAM users have more limited permissions.
title: IAM User Admins
description: Ensures the number of IAM admins in the account are minimized

recommended_action: Descrease the maximum allowed age of passwords for the password policy
title: Maximum Password Age
description: Ensures password policy requires passwords to be reset every 180 days

recommended_action: Increase the minimum length requirement for the password policy
title: Minimum Password Length
description: Ensures password policy requires a password of at least 14 characters

recommended_action: Create groups with the required policies, move the IAM users to the applicable groups, and then remove the inline and directly attached policies from the IAM user.
title: No User IAM Policies
description: Ensures IAM policies are not connected directly to IAM users

recommended_action: Enable password expiration for the account
title: Password Expiration
description: Ensures password policy enforces a password expiration

recommended_action: Update the password policy to require the use of lowercase letters
title: Password Requires Lowercase
description: Ensures password policy requires at least one lowercase letter

recommended_action: Update the password policy to require the use of numbers
title: Password Requires Numbers
description: Ensures password policy requires the use of numbers

recommended_action: Update the password policy to require the use of symbols
title: Password Requires Symbols
description: Ensures password policy requires the use of symbols

recommended_action: Update the password policy to require the use of uppercase letters
title: Password Requires Uppercase
description: Ensures password policy requires at least one uppercase letter

recommended_action: Increase the minimum previous passwors that can be reused to 24.
title: Password Reuse Prevention
description: Ensures password policy prevents previous password reuse

recommended_action: Remove access keys for the root account and setup IAM users with limited permissions instead
title: Root Access Keys
description: Ensures the root account is not using access keys

recommended_action: Create IAM users with appropriate group-level permissions for account access. Create an MFA token for the root account, and store its password and token generation QR codes in a secure place.
title: Root Account In Use
description: Ensures the root account is not being actively used

recommended_action: Enable an MFA device for the root account and then use an IAM user for managing services
title: Root MFA Enabled
description: Ensures a multi-factor authentication device is enabled for the root account

recommended_action: To rotate an SSH key, first create a new public-private key pair, then upload the public key to AWS and delete the old key.
title: SSH Keys Rotated
description: Ensures SSH keys are not older than 180 days in order to reduce accidental exposures

recommended_action: Enable an MFA device for the user account
title: Users MFA Enabled
description: Ensures a multi-factor authentication device is enabled for all users within the account

recommended_action: Delete old user accounts that allow password-based logins and have not been used recently.
title: Users Password Last Used
description: Detects users with password logins that have not been used for a period of time and that should be decommissioned

recommended_action: Enable yearly rotation for the KMS key
title: KMS Key Rotation
description: Ensures KMS keys are set to rotate on a regular schedule

recommended_action: Disable the key deletion before the scheduled deletion time.
title: KMS Scheduled Deletion
description: Detects KMS keys that are scheduled for deletion

recommended_action: Enable automated backups for the RDS instance
title: RDS Automated Backups
description: Ensures automated backups are enabled for RDS instances

recommended_action: RDS does not currently allow modifications to encryption after the instance has been launched, so a new instance will need to be created with encryption enabled.
title: RDS Encryption Enabled
description: Ensures at-rest encryption is setup for RDS instances

recommended_action: Remove the public endpoint from the RDS instance
title: RDS Publicly Accessible
description: Ensures RDS instances are not launched into the public cloud

recommended_action: Ensure the instance is running and configured properly. If the time drifts too far, consider opening a support ticket with AWS.
title: RDS Restorable
description: Ensures RDS instances can be restored to a recent point

recommended_action: Modify the RDS instance to enable scaling across multiple availability zones.
title: RDS Multiple AZ
description: Ensures that RDS instances are created to be cross-AZ for high availability.

recommended_action: Enable auto renew for the domain
title: Domain Auto Renew
description: Ensures domains are set to auto renew through Route53

recommended_action: Reregister the expiring domain
title: Domain Expiry
description: Ensures domains are not expiring too soon

recommended_action: Enable the transfer lock for the domain
title: Domain Transfer Lock
description: Ensures domains have the transfer lock set

recommended_action: Disable global all users policies on all S3 buckets
title: S3 Bucket All Users Policy
description: Ensures S3 buckets do not allow global write, delete, or read ACL permissions

recommended_action: Enable object versioning for buckets with                         sensitive contents at a minimum and for all buckets                         ideally.
title: S3 Bucket Versioning
description: Ensures object versioning is enabled on S3 buckets

recommended_action: Enable bucket logging for each S3 bucket.
title: S3 Bucket Logging
description: Ensures S3 bucket logging is enabled for S3 buckets

recommended_action: Enable DKIM for all domains and addresses in all regions used to send email through SES.
title: Email DKIM Enabled
description: Ensures DomainKeys Identified Mail (DKIM) is enabled for domains and addresses in SES.

recommended_action: Adjust the topic policy to only allow authorized AWS users in known accounts to subscribe.
title: SNS Topic Policies
description: Ensures SNS topics do not allow global send or subscribe.

recommended_action: Update the SQS policy to prevent access from external accounts.
title: SQS Cross Account Access
description: Ensures SQS policies disallow cross-account access

recommended_action: Enable encryption using KMS for all SQS queues.
title: SQS Encrypted
description: Ensures SQS encryption is enabled

recommended_action: Upgrade the Lambda function runtime to use a more current version.
title: Lambda Old Runtimes
description: Ensures Lambda functions are not using out-of-date runtime environments.

recommended_action: Enable metric filters to detect malicious activity in CloudTrail logs sent to CloudWatch.
title: CloudWatch Monitoring Metrics
description: Ensures metric filters are setup for CloudWatch logs to detect security risks from CloudTrail.

recommended_action: Redshift does not currently allow modifications to encryption after the cluster has been launched, so a new cluster will need to be created with encryption enabled.
title: Redshift Encryption Enabled
description: Ensures at-rest encryption is setup for Redshift clusters

recommended_action: Remove the public endpoint from the Redshift cluster
title: Redshift Publicly Accessible
description: Ensures Redshift clusters are not launched into the public cloud
